head module¶

class head.Head(tools, publisher)[source]¶

Bases: object

A representation of the robot head

The Head class is intended to be instantiated to a head object which aggregates the subclassed tool objects and the smoothieAPI object. It also hold a references to theQueue and publisher objects. Appropriate methods are exposed to allow access to the aggregated object’s functionality.

Todo:

  4. Is create_pipettes() needed?
calibrate_container(pipette, container)[source]¶

Set the location of a container

calibrate_pipette(pipette, property_)[source]¶

Sets the value of a property for given pipette by fetching state information from smoothieboard(smoothie_ser2net.get_state())

configure_head(head_data)[source]¶

Configure the head per Head section of protocol.json file

Example head_data:
 
head_data = dictionary of head data (example below):
“p200” : {
“tool” : “pipette”, “tip-racks” : [{“container” : “p200-rack”}], “trash-container” : {“container” : “trash”}, “tip-depth” : 5, “tip-height” : 45, “tip-total” : 8, “axis” : “a”, “volume” : 160

}, “p1000” : {

“tool” : “pipette”, “tip-racks” : [{“container” : “p1000-rack”}], “trash-container” : {“container” : “trash”}, “tip-depth” : 7, “tip-height” : 65, “tip-total” : 8, “axis” : “b”, “volume” : 800

}

create_deck(new_deck)[source]¶

Create a dictionary of new container names to be stored in each pipette given a deck list

Calls head.save_pipette_values() right before returning dictionary

Returns:container data for each axis
Return type:dictionary

move(locations)[source]¶

Moves the head by adding locations to theQueue

var locations = [location,location,...]

var location = { ‘relative’ : true || false || undefined (defaults to absolute) ‘x’ : 30, ‘y’ : 20, ‘z’ : 10, ‘a’ : 20, ‘b’ : 32 }

move_pipette(axis, property_)[source]¶

Move the pipette to one of it’s calibrated positions (top, bottom, blowout, droptip)

This command is useful for seeing saved pipette positions while calibrating

move_plunger(axis, locations)[source]¶

Move the plunger for given axis according to locations

Note:This is only called from subscriber and may be redundant

locations = [loc, loc, etc... ]

loc = {‘plunger’ : number}

Todo:
  1. Figure out if move_plunger() is redundant and refactor accordingly
on_state_change(state)[source]¶

Check the given state (from Smoothieboard) and engage theQueue (the_queue) accordingly

If the state is 1 or the state.delaying is 1 then theQueue is_busy,

else if the state is 0 and the state.delaying is 0, theQueue is not busy, clear the currentCommand for the next one, and if not paused, tell theQueue to step. Then update theState.

Todo:
  1. Should theState be updated BEFORE the actions taken from given state?
pipette(group)[source]¶

Run a pipette operation based on a given Group from protocol instructions

group = {
command : ‘pipette’, axis : ‘a’ || ‘b’, locations : [location, location, ...]

}

location = {
x : number, y : number, z : number, container : string, plunger : float || ‘blowout’ || ‘droptip’

}

If no container is specified, XYZ coordinates are absolute to the Smoothieboard if a container is specified, XYZ coordinates are relative to the container’s origin (180 degree rotation around X axis, ie Z and Y +/- flipped)

step(locations)[source]¶

Step to the next command in theQueue(the_queue) object’s qlist

locations = [location,location,...]

location = { ‘x’ : 30, ‘y’ : 20, ‘z’ : 10, ‘a’ : 20, ‘b’ : 32 }

theState = {'z': 0, 'b': 0, 'x': 0, 'y': 0, 'a': 0}¶
